content:
ToolboxCategory Class

Definition

A collection of toolbox items that have been categorized.

In this Article

public sealed class ToolboxCategory : System.Collections.IList, System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged
Inheritance
System.Object
ToolboxCategory

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The ToolboxCategory collection contains items of type ToolboxItemWrapper that are added and removed from an instance of the collection using the Add and Remove methods.

The ToolboxCategory class implements the INotifyPropertyChanged interface. This allows the collection that is storing the toolbox items to provide notifications when properties like the CategoryName property are changed and methods like Add and Remove are used to change the contents of the collection.

Constructors

ToolboxCategory()

Creates an instance of the ToolboxCategory class.

public ToolboxCategory ();

Remarks

The default name assigned to the ToolboxCategory collection is an empty string.

ToolboxCategory(String)

Creates an instance of the ToolboxCategory class with a specified name.

public ToolboxCategory (string name);
name
String

The name of the toolbox category collection.

Remarks

The name assigned to the ToolboxCategory collection can be an empty string. This is the value assigned by the default constructor, ToolboxCategory.

Properties

CategoryName

Gets or sets the name of the toolbox category.

public string CategoryName { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the toolbox category.

Remarks

When set, the property provides a notification.

Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the tool at the specified index.

public System.Activities.Presentation.Toolbox.ToolboxItemWrapper this[int index] { get; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the tool to get or set.

Value
ToolboxItemWrapper

The ToolboxItemWrapper object at the specified index..

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index is not valid for the ToolboxCategory collection.

Tools

Gets the tools in the ToolboxCategory.

public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Activities.Presentation.Toolbox.ToolboxItemWrapper> Tools { get; }
Value
ICollection<ToolboxItemWrapper>

Anstem.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1 that contains the ToolboxCategory.

Methods

Add(ToolboxItemWrapper)

Adds a specified tool to the end of the toolbox category collection.

public void Add (System.Activities.Presentation.Toolbox.ToolboxItemWrapper tool);
tool
ToolboxItemWrapper

The ToolboxItemWrapper item to add to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The tool is null.

Remove(ToolboxItemWrapper)

Removes the first occurrence of a specified tool from the toolbox category collection.

public bool Remove (System.Activities.Presentation.Toolbox.ToolboxItemWrapper tool);
tool
ToolboxItemWrapper

The ToolboxItemWrapper item to remove from the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the tool is successfully removed; otherwise, false. This method also returns false if the tool was not found in the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The tool is null.

Events

PropertyChanged

Occurs when a property value changes.

public event System.ComponentModel.PropertyChangedEventHandler PropertyChanged;

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the entire ToolboxCategory collection to a compatible one-dimensional Array, starting at the specified index of the target Array.

void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from the ToolboxCategory collection. The Array must have zero-based indexing.

index
Int32

The index of the array at which the copying begins.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The array is null.

Remarks

The elements are copied to the Array in the same order in which the enumerator iterates through the ToolboxCategory collection.

ICollection.Count

Gets the number of tools contained in the ToolboxCategory.

int System.Collections.ICollection.Count { get; }
Returns
Int32

The number of elements contained in the ToolboxCategory.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the ICollection interface.

ICollection.IsSynchronized

Gets a value that indicates whether access to the ToolboxCategory is synchronized (thread safe).

bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if access to the ToolboxCategory is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, false.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the ICollection interface. The System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot property returns an object, which can be used to synchronize access to the ToolboxCategory.

ICollection.SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the ToolboxCategory.

object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }
Returns
System.Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the ToolboxCategory.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the ICollection interface.

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that iterates through the ToolboxCategory collection.

System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An stem.Collections.IEnumerator`1 for the ToolboxCategory.

Remarks

Enumerators can be used to read the data in a collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.

Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. At this position, Current is undefined. Therefore, you must call MoveNext() to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of Current. An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is no longer valid and its behavior is undefined.

The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

IList.Add(Object)

Adds a tool to the ToolboxCategory.

int IList.Add (object value);
value
System.Object

The position into which the new element is inserted.

Returns
Int32

The zero-based index of the tool added to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value is of a type that is not assignable to the IList implemented by the collection.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface.

IList.Clear()

Removes all the tools from the ToolboxCategory.

void IList.Clear ();

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface.

IList.Contains(Object)

Determines whether the ToolboxCategory contains a specific tool.

bool IList.Contains (object value);
value
System.Object

The tool Object to locate in the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the value is found in the ToolboxCategory; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value is null.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface.

IList.IndexOf(Object)

Determines the index of a specific tool in the ToolboxCategory.

int IList.IndexOf (object value);
value
System.Object

The Object to locate in the ToolboxCategory.

Returns
Int32

The zero-based index of value if found in the ToolboxCategory; otherwise, -1.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value is null.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface.

IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

Inserts a tool into the ToolboxCategory at the specified index.

void IList.Insert (int index, object value);
index
Int32

The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.

value
System.Object

The tool added to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index is not valid for the ToolboxCategory collection.

ArgumentNullException

The value is null.

NotSupportedException

The ToolboxCategory is read-only, or it has a fixed size that has been exceeded.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface.

If index equals the number of items in the IList, then value is appended to the end.

In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element. If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated.

IList.IsFixedSize

Gets a value that indicates whether the ToolboxCategory has a fixed size.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the ToolboxCategory has a fixed size; otherwise, false.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface.

IList.IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether the ToolboxCategory is read-only.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the ToolboxCategory is read-only; otherwise, false.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface. A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created.

IList.Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the tool at the specified index.

object System.Collections.IList.Item[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the tool item to get or set.

Returns
System.Object

The toolObject at the specified index.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface. This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: myCollection[index].

IList.Remove(Object)

Removes the first occurrence of a specific tool from the ToolboxCategory.

void IList.Remove (object value);
value
System.Object

The tool Object to remove from the ToolboxCategory.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface.

In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot. If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated.

IList.RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the tool at the specified index of the ToolboxCategory collection.

void IList.RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the tool item to remove.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index is not valid for the ToolboxCategory collection.

Remarks

ToolboxCategory implements the IList interface.

In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot. If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated.
